alert.note: Alert for Grant (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Grant County through 100 PM EDT... At 1237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Swayzee, or 11 miles west of Fairmount, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Swayzee around 1240 PM EDT. Marion and Fairmount around 1250 PM EDT. Gas City and Jonesboro around 1255 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Upland and Matthews. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for central and east central Indiana.
